tags.name: Artifacts
tags.description: Provides methods for working with artifacts produced by builds.

tags.name: Badge
tags.description: Provides methods to generate SVG images representing the status of builds.

tags.name: Builds
tags.description: Provides methods for working with builds.

tags.name: Definitions
tags.description: Provides methods for working with build definitions.

tags.name: Folders
tags.description: Provides methods for working with folders of build definitions.

tags.name: General Settings
tags.description: Provides methods for working with general pipeline settings.

tags.name: Latest
tags.description: Provides methods to return the latest builds for definitions.

tags.name: Leases
tags.description: Retention leases are used to manage the lifetime of pipeline runs beyond the configured retention periods.

tags.name: Metrics
tags.description: Provides methods for getting summary information about builds that have run in the system.

tags.name: Options
tags.description: Provides methods for discovering build definition options supported by the system.

tags.name: Properties
tags.description: Provides methods for working with extended properties of builds and definitions.

tags.name: Report
tags.description: Provides methods for working with build reports.

tags.name: Resource Usage
tags.description: Provides information about build resources in the system.

tags.name: Retention
tags.description: Provides methods for updating pipeline retention settings.

tags.name: Settings
tags.description: Provides methods for updating build-related system settings.

tags.name: Source Providers
tags.description: Provides methods for working with source providers.

tags.name: Status
tags.description: Provides methods to generate SVG images representing the status of builds.

tags.name: Tags
tags.description: Provides methods for working with tags for builds and definitions.

tags.name: Templates
tags.description: Provides methods for working with build definition templates.

get.description: Gets a list of builds.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: definitions
parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of definition IDs. If specified, filters to builds for these definitions.

parameters.name: queues
parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of queue IDs. If specified, filters to builds that ran against these queues.

parameters.name: buildNumber
parameters.description: If specified, filters to builds that match this build number. Append * to do a prefix search.

parameters.name: minTime
parameters.description: If specified, filters to builds that finished/started/queued after this date based on the queryOrder specified.

parameters.name: maxTime
parameters.description: If specified, filters to builds that finished/started/queued before this date based on the queryOrder specified.

parameters.name: requestedFor
parameters.description: If specified, filters to builds requested for the specified user.

parameters.name: reasonFilter
parameters.description: If specified, filters to builds that match this reason.

values.description: No reason. This value should not be used.
The build was started manually.
The build was started for the trigger TriggerType.ContinuousIntegration.
The build was started for the trigger TriggerType.BatchedContinuousIntegration.
The build was started for the trigger TriggerType.Schedule.
The build was started for the trigger TriggerType.ScheduleForced.
The build was created by a user.
The build was started manually for private validation.
The build was started for the trigger ContinuousIntegrationType.Gated.
The build was started by a pull request. Added in resource version 3.
The build was started when another build completed.
The build was started when resources in pipeline triggered it
The build was triggered for retention policy purposes.
All reasons.

parameters.name: statusFilter
parameters.description: If specified, filters to builds that match this status.

values.description: No status.
The build is currently in progress.
The build has completed.
The build is cancelling
The build is inactive in the queue.
The build has not yet started.
All status.

parameters.name: resultFilter
parameters.description: If specified, filters to builds that match this result.

values.description: No result
The build completed successfully.
The build completed compilation successfully but had other errors.
The build completed unsuccessfully.
The build was canceled before starting.

parameters.name: tagFilters
parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of tags. If specified, filters to builds that have the specified tags.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of properties to retrieve.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: The maximum number of builds to return.

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description: A continuation token, returned by a previous call to this method, that can be used to return the next set of builds.

parameters.name: maxBuildsPerDefinition
parameters.description: The maximum number of builds to return per definition.

parameters.name: deletedFilter
parameters.description: Indicates whether to exclude, include, or only return deleted builds.

values.description: Include only non-deleted builds.
Include deleted and non-deleted builds.
Include only deleted builds.

parameters.name: queryOrder
parameters.description: The order in which builds should be returned.

values.description: Order by finish time ascending.
Order by finish time descending.
Order by queue time descending.
Order by queue time ascending.
Order by start time descending.
Order by start time ascending.

parameters.name: branchName
parameters.description: If specified, filters to builds that built branches that built this branch.

parameters.name: buildIds
parameters.description: A comma-delimited list that specifies the IDs of builds to retrieve.

parameters.name: repositoryId
parameters.description: If specified, filters to builds that built from this repository.

parameters.name: repositoryType
parameters.description: If specified, filters to builds that built from repositories of this type.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: definitionId
parameters.description: Optional definition id to queue a build without a body. Ignored if there's a valid body

parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The builds to update.

get.description: Gets a list of definitions.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: If specified, filters to definitions whose names match this pattern.

parameters.name: repositoryId
parameters.description: A repository ID. If specified, filters to definitions that use this repository.

parameters.name: repositoryType
parameters.description: If specified, filters to definitions that have a repository of this type.

parameters.name: queryOrder
parameters.description: Indicates the order in which definitions should be returned.

values.description: No order
Order by created on/last modified time ascending.
Order by created on/last modified time descending.
Order by definition name ascending.
Order by definition name descending.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: The maximum number of definitions to return.

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description: A continuation token, returned by a previous call to this method, that can be used to return the next set of definitions.

parameters.name: minMetricsTime
parameters.description: If specified, indicates the date from which metrics should be included.

parameters.name: definitionIds
parameters.description: A comma-delimited list that specifies the IDs of definitions to retrieve.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: If specified, filters to definitions under this folder.

parameters.name: builtAfter
parameters.description: If specified, filters to definitions that have builds after this date.

parameters.name: notBuiltAfter
parameters.description: If specified, filters to definitions that do not have builds after this date.

parameters.name: includeAllProperties
parameters.description: Indicates whether the full definitions should be returned. By default, shallow representations of the definitions are returned.

parameters.name: includeLatestBuilds
parameters.description: Indicates whether to return the latest and latest completed builds for this definition.

parameters.name: taskIdFilter
parameters.description: If specified, filters to definitions that use the specified task.

parameters.name: processType
parameters.description: If specified, filters to definitions with the given process type.

parameters.name: yamlFilename
parameters.description: If specified, filters to YAML definitions that match the given filename.

delete.description: Deletes a definition and all associated builds.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: definitionId
parameters.description: The ID of the definition.

parameters.name: minMetricsTime
parameters.description: If specified, indicates the date from which metrics should be included.

parameters.name: propertyFilters
parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of properties to include in the results.

parameters.name: organization

parameters.name: project

parameters.name: definitionId

parameters.name: body

get.description:
Gets the build status for a definition, optionally scoped to a specific branch, stage, job, and configuration.

If there are more than one, then it is required to pass in a stageName value when specifying a jobName, and the same rule then applies for both if passing a configuration parameter.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: definition
parameters.description: Either the definition name with optional leading folder path, or the definition id.

parameters.name: branchName
parameters.description: Only consider the most recent build for this branch.

parameters.name: stageName
parameters.description: Use this stage within the pipeline to render the status.

parameters.name: jobName
parameters.description: Use this job within a stage of the pipeline to render the status.

parameters.name: configuration
parameters.description: Use this job configuration to render the status

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Replaces the default text on the left side of the badge.

get.description: Gets a list of branches for the given source code repository.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: providerName
parameters.description: The name of the source provider.

parameters.name: serviceEndpointId
parameters.description: If specified, the ID of the service endpoint to query. Can only be omitted for providers that do not use service endpoints, e.g. TFVC or TFGit.

parameters.name: repository
parameters.description: The vendor-specific identifier or the name of the repository to get branches. Can only be omitted for providers that do not support multiple repositories.

parameters.name: branchName
parameters.description: If supplied, the name of the branch to check for specifically.

parameters.description: If specified, the ID of the service endpoint to query. Can only be omitted for providers that do not use service endpoints, e.g. TFVC or TFGit.

parameters.name: repository
parameters.description: If specified, the vendor-specific identifier or the name of the repository to get branches. Can only be omitted for providers that do not support multiple repositories.

parameters.name: commitOrBranch
parameters.description: The identifier of the commit or branch from which a file's contents are retrieved.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to the file to retrieve, relative to the root of the repository.

get.description: Gets the contents of a directory in the given source code repository.

parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: providerName
parameters.description: The name of the source provider.

parameters.name: serviceEndpointId
parameters.description: If specified, the ID of the service endpoint to query. Can only be omitted for providers that do not use service endpoints, e.g. TFVC or TFGit.

parameters.name: repository
parameters.description: If specified, the vendor-specific identifier or the name of the repository to get branches. Can only be omitted for providers that do not support multiple repositories.

parameters.name: commitOrBranch
parameters.description: The identifier of the commit or branch from which a file's contents are retrieved.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path contents to list, relative to the root of the repository.

get.description: Gets a pull request object from source provider.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: providerName
parameters.description: The name of the source provider.

parameters.name: pullRequestId
parameters.description: Vendor-specific id of the pull request.

parameters.name: repositoryId
parameters.description: Vendor-specific identifier or the name of the repository that contains the pull request.

parameters.name: serviceEndpointId
parameters.description: If specified, the ID of the service endpoint to query. Can only be omitted for providers that do not use service endpoints, e.g. TFVC or TFGit.

get.description: Gets a list of source code repositories.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: providerName
parameters.description: The name of the source provider.

parameters.name: serviceEndpointId
parameters.description: If specified, the ID of the service endpoint to query. Can only be omitted for providers that do not use service endpoints, e.g. TFVC or TFGit.

parameters.name: repository
parameters.description: If specified, the vendor-specific identifier or the name of a single repository to get.

parameters.name: resultSet
parameters.description: 'top' for the repositories most relevant for the endpoint. If not set, all repositories are returned. Ignored if 'repository' is set.

values.description: Include all repositories
Include most relevant repositories for user

parameters.name: pageResults
parameters.description: If set to true, this will limit the set of results and will return a continuation token to continue the query.

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description: When paging results, this is a continuation token, returned by a previous call to this method, that can be used to return the next set of repositories.

post.description: Recreates the webhooks for the specified triggers in the given source code repository.

parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The types of triggers to restore webhooks for.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: providerName
parameters.description: The name of the source provider.

parameters.name: serviceEndpointId
parameters.description: If specified, the ID of the service endpoint to query. Can only be omitted for providers that do not use service endpoints, e.g. TFVC or TFGit.

parameters.name: repository
parameters.description: If specified, the vendor-specific identifier or the name of the repository to get webhooks. Can only be omitted for providers that do not support multiple repositories.

get.description: Returns any leases owned by the specified user, optionally scoped to a single pipeline definition and run.
get.operationId: Leases_Get Retention Leases By User Id

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: userOwnerId
parameters.description: The user id to search for.

parameters.name: definitionId
parameters.description: An optional parameter to limit the search to a specific pipeline definition.

parameters.name: runId
parameters.description: An optional parameter to limit the search to a single pipeline run. Requires definitionId.

get.description: Returns any leases owned by the specified entity, optionally scoped to a single pipeline definition and run.
get.operationId: Leases_Get Retention Leases By Owner Id

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: definitionId
parameters.description: An optional parameter to limit the search to a specific pipeline definition.

parameters.name: runId
parameters.description: An optional parameter to limit the search to a single pipeline run. Requires definitionId.

AgentPoolQueue.description: Represents a queue for running builds.

name.description: The name of the queue.

pool.description: The pool used by this queue.

url.description: The full http link to the resource.

AgentPoolQueueReference.description: Represents a reference to an agent queue.

AgentPoolQueueTarget.description: Describes how a phase should run against an agent queue.

allowScriptsAuthAccessOption.description: Enables scripts and other processes launched while executing phase to access the OAuth token

AgentSpecification.description: Specification of the agent defined by the pool provider.

AgentTargetExecutionOptions.description: Additional options for running phases against an agent queue.

type.description: Indicates the type of execution options.

values.description: Only used during an update to preserve the existing value.
Test has not been completed, or the test type does not report pass/failure.
Test was executed w/o any issues.
Test was executed, but there were issues. Issues may involve exceptions or failed assertions.
Test has completed, but we can't say if it passed or failed. May be used for aborted tests...
The test timed out
Test was aborted. This was not caused by a user gesture, but rather by a framework decision.
Test had it chance for been executed but was not, as ITestElement.IsRunnable == false.
Test was not executed. This was caused by a user gesture - e.g. user hit stop button.
To be used by Run level results. This is not a failure.
There was a system error while we were trying to execute a test.
Test is Not Applicable for execution.
Test is paused.
Test is currently executing. Added this for TCM charts
Test is not impacted. Added fot TIA.
Run with zero failed tests and has at least one impacted test
Run with at-least one failed test.
Run with no impacted tests.
Runs with All tests in other category.
Only used during an update to preserve the existing value.
The run is still being created.  No tests have started yet.
Tests are running.
All tests have completed or been skipped.
Run is stopped and remaining tests have been aborted
Run is currently initializing This is a legacy state and should not be used any more
Run requires investigation because of a test point failure This is a legacy state and should not be used any more

downloadUrl.description: A link to download the resource.

type.description: The type of the resource: File container, version control folder, UNC path, etc.

url.description: The full http link to the resource.

id.description: Id of associated the work item.

url.description: REST Url of the work item.

Attachment.description: Represents an attachment to a build.

name.description: The name of the attachment.

agentSpecification.description: The agent specification for the build.

buildNumber.description: The build number/name of the build.

controller.description: The build controller. This is only set if the definition type is Xaml.

definition.description: The definition associated with the build.

deleted.description: Indicates whether the build has been deleted.

deletedBy.description: The identity of the process or person that deleted the build.

deletedDate.description: The date the build was deleted.

deletedReason.description: The description of how the build was deleted.

demands.description: A list of demands that represents the agent capabilities required by this build.

finishTime.description: The time that the build was completed.

keepForever.description: Indicates whether the build should be skipped by retention policies.

lastChangedBy.description: The identity representing the process or person that last changed the build.

lastChangedDate.description: The date the build was last changed.

orchestrationPlan.description: The orchestration plan for the build.

parameters.description: The parameters for the build.

plans.description: Orchestration plans associated with the build (build, cleanup)

values.description: Low priority.
Below normal priority.
Normal priority.
Above normal priority.
High priority.

quality.description: The quality of the xaml build (good, bad, etc.)

queue.description: The queue. This is only set if the definition type is Build.

queueOptions.description: Additional options for queueing the build.

values.description: No queue options
Create a plan Id for the build, do not run it

queuePosition.description: The current position of the build in the queue.

queueTime.description: The time that the build was queued.

reason.description: The reason that the build was created.

values.description: No reason. This value should not be used.
The build was started manually.
The build was started for the trigger TriggerType.ContinuousIntegration.
The build was started for the trigger TriggerType.BatchedContinuousIntegration.
The build was started for the trigger TriggerType.Schedule.
The build was started for the trigger TriggerType.ScheduleForced.
The build was created by a user.
The build was started manually for private validation.
The build was started for the trigger ContinuousIntegrationType.Gated.
The build was started by a pull request. Added in resource version 3.
The build was started when another build completed.
The build was started when resources in pipeline triggered it
The build was triggered for retention policy purposes.
All reasons.

requestedBy.description: The identity that queued the build.

requestedFor.description: The identity on whose behalf the build was queued.

values.description: No result
The build completed successfully.
The build completed compilation successfully but had other errors.
The build completed unsuccessfully.
The build was canceled before starting.

retainedByRelease.description: Indicates whether the build is retained by a release.

startTime.description: The time that the build was started.

values.description: No status.
The build is currently in progress.
The build has completed.
The build is cancelling
The build is inactive in the queue.
The build has not yet started.
All status.

triggeredByBuild.description: The build that triggered this build via a Build completion trigger.

triggerInfo.description: Sourceprovider-specific information about what triggered the build

url.description: The REST URL of the build.

values.description: Indicates that the build agent cannot be contacted.
Indicates that the build agent is currently available.
Indicates that the build agent has taken itself offline.

name.description: Name of the linked resource (definition name, controller name, etc.)

url.description: Full http link to the resource

BuildArtifact.description: Represents an artifact produced by a build.

name.description: The name of the artifact.

source.description: The artifact source, which will be the ID of the job that produced this artifact. If an artifact is associated with multiple sources, this points to the first source.

buildId.description: The ID of the build represented by this badge.

imageUrl.description: A link to the SVG resource.

changes.description: Changes associated with a build used for build notifications

pullRequest.description: Pull request for the build used for build notifications

testResults.description: Test results associated with a build used for build notifications

timelineRecords.description: Timeline records associated with a build used for build notifications

workItems.description: Work items associated with a build used for build notifications

definition.description: A reference to the definition that should trigger builds for this definition.

createdDate.description: The date the controller was created.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the controller is enabled.

values.description: Indicates that the build controller cannot be contacted.
Indicates that the build controller is currently available.
Indicates that the build controller has taken itself offline.

updatedDate.description: The date the controller was last updated.

badgeEnabled.description: Indicates whether badges are enabled for this definition.

comment.description: A save-time comment for the definition.

dropLocation.description: The drop location for the definition.

jobAuthorizationScope.description: The job authorization scope for builds queued against this definition.

values.description: The identity used should have build service account permissions scoped to the project collection. This is useful when resources for a single build are spread across multiple projects.

The identity used should have build service account permissions scoped to the project in which the build definition resides. This is useful for isolation of build jobs to a particular team project to avoid any unintentional escalation of privilege attacks during a build.

jobCancelTimeoutInMinutes.description: The job cancel timeout (in minutes) for builds cancelled by user for this definition.

jobTimeoutInMinutes.description: The job execution timeout (in minutes) for builds queued against this definition.

processParameters.description: The process parameters for this definition.

BuildDefinition3_2.description: For back-compat with extensions that use the old Steps format instead of Process and Phases

badgeEnabled.description: Indicates whether badges are enabled for this definition

comment.description: The comment entered when saving the definition

dropLocation.description: The drop location for the definition

jobAuthorizationScope.description: The job authorization scope for builds which are queued against this definition

values.description: The identity used should have build service account permissions scoped to the project collection. This is useful when resources for a single build are spread across multiple projects.

The identity used should have build service account permissions scoped to the project in which the build definition resides. This is useful for isolation of build jobs to a particular team project to avoid any unintentional escalation of privilege attacks during a build.

jobCancelTimeoutInMinutes.description: The job cancel timeout in minutes for builds which are cancelled by user for this definition

jobTimeoutInMinutes.description: The job execution timeout in minutes for builds which are queued against this definition

BuildDefinitionReference.description: Represents a reference to a build definition.

draftOf.description: A reference to the definition that this definition is a draft of, if this is a draft definition.

drafts.description: The list of drafts associated with this definition, if this is not a draft definition.

quality.description: The quality of the definition document (draft, etc.)

queue.description: The default queue for builds run against this definition.

BuildDefinitionReference3_2.description: For back-compat with extensions that use the old Steps format instead of Process and Phases

draftOf.description: A reference to the definition that this definition is a draft of, if this is a draft definition.

drafts.description: The list of drafts associated with this definition, if this is not a draft definition.

quality.description: The quality of the definition document (draft, etc.)

queue.description: The default queue for builds run against this definition.

BuildDefinitionRevision.description: Represents a revision of a build definition.

changedBy.description: The identity of the person or process that changed the definition.

changedDate.description: The date and time that the definition was changed.

comment.description: The comment associated with the change.

definitionUrl.description: A link to the definition at this revision.

name.description: The name of the definition.

fields.description: fields associated with this build definition

lastModified.description: The lst time this source provider was modified

name.description: Name of the source provider

supportedTriggerTypes.description: Which trigger types are supported by this definition source provider

values.description: Manual builds only.
A build should be started for each changeset.
A build should be started for multiple changesets at a time at a specified interval.
A build should be started on a specified schedule whether or not changesets exist.
A validation build should be started for each check-in.
A validation build should be started for each batch of check-ins.
A build should be triggered when a GitHub pull request is created or updated. Added in resource version 3
A build should be triggered when another build completes.
All types.

BuildDefinitionStep.description: Represents a step in a build phase.

alwaysRun.description: Indicates whether this step should run even if a previous step fails.

condition.description: A condition that determines whether this step should run.

continueOnError.description: Indicates whether the phase should continue even if this step fails.

displayName.description: The display name for this step.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the step is enabled.

refName.description: The reference name for this step.

task.description: The task associated with this step.

timeoutInMinutes.description: The time, in minutes, that this step is allowed to run.

BuildDefinitionTemplate.description: Represents a template from which new build definitions can be created.

canDelete.description: Indicates whether the template can be deleted.

defaultHostedQueue.description: An optional hosted agent queue for the template to use by default.

iconTaskId.description: The ID of the task whose icon is used when showing this template in the UI.

name.description: The name of the template.

BuildDefinitionTemplate3_2.description: For back-compat with extensions that use the old Steps format instead of Process and Phases

BuildDefinitionVariable.description: Represents a variable used by a build definition.

allowOverride.description: Indicates whether the value can be set at queue time.

isSecret.description: Indicates whether the variable's value is a secret.

createdOn.description: The date and time the log was created.

lastChangedOn.description: The date and time the log was last changed.

lineCount.description: The number of lines in the log.

BuildLogReference.description: Represents a reference to a build log.

type.description: The type of the log location.

url.description: A full link to the log resource.

BuildMetric.description: Represents metadata about builds in the system.

name.description: The name of the metric.

BuildOption.description: Represents the application of an optional behavior to a build definition.

definition.description: A reference to the build option.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the behavior is enabled.

BuildOptionDefinition.description: Represents an optional behavior that can be applied to a build definition.

groups.description: The list of input groups defined for the build option.

inputs.description: The list of inputs defined for the build option.

name.description: The name of the build option.

ordinal.description: A value that indicates the relative order in which the behavior should be applied.

BuildOptionDefinitionReference.description: Represents a reference to a build option definition.

id.description: The ID of the referenced build option.

BuildOptionGroupDefinition.description: Represents a group of inputs for a build option.

displayName.description: The name of the group to display in the UI.

isExpanded.description: Indicates whether the group is initially displayed as expanded in the UI.

name.description: The internal name of the group.

BuildOptionInputDefinition.description: Represents an input for a build option.

groupName.description: The name of the input group that this input belongs to.

name.description: The name of the input.

required.description: Indicates whether the input is required to have a value.

type.description: Indicates the type of the input value.

visibleRule.description: The rule that is applied to determine whether the input is visible in the UI.

BuildProcessResources.description: Represents resources used by a build process.

BuildTrigger.description: Represents a trigger for a buld definition.

values.description: Manual builds only.
A build should be started for each changeset.
A build should be started for multiple changesets at a time at a specified interval.
A build should be started on a specified schedule whether or not changesets exist.

All types.

Change.description: Represents a change associated with a build.

displayUri.description: The location of a user-friendly representation of the resource.

id.description: The identifier for the change. For a commit, this would be the SHA1. For a TFVC changeset, this would be the changeset ID.

location.description: The location of the full representation of the resource.

message.description: The description of the change. This might be a commit message or changeset description.

messageTruncated.description: Indicates whether the message was truncated.

pusher.description: The person or process that pushed the change.

connectedService.description: The connected service associated with the continuous deployment

definition.description: The definition associated with the continuous deployment

batchChanges.description: Indicates whether changes should be batched while another CI build is running.

maxConcurrentBuildsPerBranch.description: The maximum number of simultaneous CI builds that will run per branch.

pollingJobId.description: The ID of the job used to poll an external repository.

DataSourceBindingBase.description: Represents binding of data source for the service endpoint request.

callbackContextTemplate.description: Pagination format supported by this data source(ContinuationToken/SkipTop).

dataSourceName.description: Gets or sets the name of the data source.

endpointId.description: Gets or sets the endpoint Id.

endpointUrl.description: Gets or sets the url of the service endpoint.

headers.description: Gets or sets the authorization headers.

initialContextTemplate.description: Defines the initial value of the query params

parameters.description: Gets or sets the parameters for the data source.

requestContent.description: Gets or sets http request body

requestVerb.description: Gets or sets http request verb

resultSelector.description: Gets or sets the result selector.

resultTemplate.description: Gets or sets the result template.

target.description: Gets or sets the target of the data source.

DefinitionReference.description: Represents a reference to a definition.

createdDate.description: The date this version of the definition was created.

id.description: The ID of the referenced definition.

name.description: The name of the referenced definition.

path.description: The folder path of the definition.

queueStatus.description: A value that indicates whether builds can be queued against this definition.

values.description: When enabled the definition queue allows builds to be queued by users, the system will queue scheduled, gated and continuous integration builds, and the queued builds will be started by the system.

When paused the definition queue allows builds to be queued by users and the system will queue scheduled, gated and continuous integration builds. Builds in the queue will not be started by the system.

When disabled the definition queue will not allow builds to be queued by users and the system will not queue scheduled, gated or continuous integration builds. Builds already in the queue will not be started by the system.

url.description: The REST URL of the definition.

authorized.description: Indicates whether the resource is authorized for use.

name.description: A friendly name for the resource.

Demand.description: Represents a demand used by a definition or build.

name.description: The name of the capability referenced by the demand.

event.description: The event. The dependency is satisfied when the referenced object emits this event.

scope.description: The scope. This names the object referenced by the dependency.

Deployment.description: Represents the data from the build information nodes for type "DeploymentInformation" for xaml builds

DesignerProcess.description: Represents a build process supported by the build definition designer.

target.description: The target for the build process.

DesignerProcessTarget.description: Represents the target for the build process.

agentSpecification.description: Agent specification for the build process.

DockerProcessTarget.description: Represents the target for the docker build process.

Folder.description: Represents a folder that contains build definitions.

createdBy.description: The process or person who created the folder.

createdOn.description: The date the folder was created.

lastChangedBy.description: The process or person that last changed the folder.

lastChangedDate.description: The date the folder was last changed.

Forks.description: Represents the ability to build forks of the selected repository.

allowSecrets.description: Indicates whether a build should use secrets when building forks of the selected repository.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the trigger should queue builds for forks of the selected repository.

runContinuousIntegration.description: Indicates whether CI triggers should run after the gated check-in succeeds.

useWorkspaceMappings.description: Indicates whether to take workspace mappings into account when determining whether a build should run.

_links.description: This field contains zero or more interesting links about the graph subject. These links may be invoked to obtain additional relationships or more detailed information about this graph subject.

descriptor.description: The descriptor is the primary way to reference the graph subject while the system is running. This field will uniquely identify the same graph subject across both Accounts and Organizations.

displayName.description: This is the non-unique display name of the graph subject. To change this field, you must alter its value in the source provider.

url.description: This url is the full route to the source resource of this graph subject.

directoryAlias.description: Deprecated - Can be retrieved by querying the Graph user referenced in the "self" entry of the IdentityRef "_links" dictionary

imageUrl.description: Deprecated - Available in the "avatar" entry of the IdentityRef "_links" dictionary

inactive.description: Deprecated - Can be retrieved by querying the Graph membership state referenced in the "membershipState" entry of the GraphUser "_links" dictionary

isAadIdentity.description: Deprecated - Can be inferred from the subject type of the descriptor (Descriptor.IsAadUserType/Descriptor.IsAadGroupType)

isContainer.description: Deprecated - Can be inferred from the subject type of the descriptor (Descriptor.IsGroupType)

profileUrl.description: Deprecated - not in use in most preexisting implementations of ToIdentityRef

InformationNode.description: Data representation of an information node associated with a build

lastModifiedBy.description: Process or person that last modified this node

lastModifiedDate.description: Date this node was last modified

nodeId.description: Node Id of this information node

type.description: The type of the information node

Issue.description: Represents an issue (error, warning) associated with a build.

type.description: The type (error, warning) of the issue.

JobReference.description: Job in pipeline. This is related to matrixing in YAML.

jobName.description: Matrixing in YAML generates copies of a job with different inputs in matrix. JobName is the name of those input. Maximum supported length for name is 256 character.

JsonPatchDocument.description: The JSON model for JSON Patch Operations

JsonPatchOperation.description: The JSON model for a JSON Patch operation

from.description: The path to copy from for the Move/Copy operation.

path.description: The path for the operation. In the case of an array, a zero based index can be used to specify the position in the array (e.g. /biscuits/0/name). The "-" character can be used instead of an index to insert at the end of the array (e.g. /biscuits/-).

value.description: The value for the operation. This is either a primitive or a JToken.

MappingDetails.description: Represents an entry in a workspace mapping.

definitionId.description: The pipeline definition of the run.

ownerId.description: User-provided string that identifies the owner of a retention lease.

MultipleAgentExecutionOptions.description: Represents options for running a phase against multiple agents.

continueOnError.description: Indicates whether failure on one agent should prevent the phase from running on other agents.

maxConcurrency.description: The maximum number of agents to use simultaneously.

daysValid.description: The number of days to consider the lease valid.

definitionId.description: The pipeline definition of the run.

ownerId.description: User-provided string that identifies the owner of a retention lease.

protectPipeline.description: If set, this lease will also prevent the pipeline from being deleted while the lease is still valid.

Phase.description: Represents a phase of a build definition.

condition.description: The condition that must be true for this phase to execute.

jobAuthorizationScope.description: The job authorization scope for builds queued against this definition.

values.description: The identity used should have build service account permissions scoped to the project collection. This is useful when resources for a single build are spread across multiple projects.

The identity used should have build service account permissions scoped to the project in which the build definition resides. This is useful for isolation of build jobs to a particular team project to avoid any unintentional escalation of privilege attacks during a build.

jobCancelTimeoutInMinutes.description: The cancellation timeout, in minutes, for builds queued against this definition.

jobTimeoutInMinutes.description: The job execution timeout, in minutes, for builds queued against this definition.

name.description: The name of the phase.

refName.description: The unique ref name of the phase.

target.description: The target (agent, server, etc.) for this phase.

phaseName.description: Name of the phase. Maximum supported length for name is 256 character.

PhaseTarget.description: Represents the target of a phase.

enforceJobAuthScope.description: If enabled, scope of access for all pipelines reduces to the current project.

enforceReferencedRepoScopedToken.description: Restricts the scope of access for all pipelines to only repositories explicitly referenced by the pipeline.

enforceSettableVar.description: If enabled, only those variables that are explicitly marked as "Settable at queue time" can be set at queue time.

statusBadgesArePrivate.description: Anonymous users can access the status badge API for all pipelines unless this option is enabled.

pipelineId.description: Reference of the pipeline with which this pipeline instance is related.

ProjectRetentionSetting.description: Contains the settings for the retention rules.

purgeArtifacts.description: The rules for artifact retention. Artifacts can not live longer than a run, so will be overridden by a shorter run purge setting.

purgePullRequestRuns.description: The rules for pull request pipeline run retention.

purgeRuns.description: The rules for pipeline run retention.

retainRunsPerProtectedBranch.description: The rules for retaining runs per protected branch.

PropertiesCollection.description: The class represents a property bag as a collection of key-value pairs. Values of all primitive types (any type with a `TypeCode != TypeCode.Object`) except for `DBNull` are accepted. Values of type Byte[], Int32, Double, DateType and String preserve their type, other primitives are retuned as a String. Byte[] expected as base64 encoded string.

count.description: The count of properties in the collection.

keys.description: The set of keys in the collection.

values.description: The set of values in the collection.

PullRequest.description: Represents a pull request object.  These are retrieved from Source Providers.

_links.description: The links to other objects related to this object.

currentState.description: Current state of the pull request, e.g. open, merged, closed, conflicts, etc.

id.description: Unique identifier for the pull request

providerName.description: The name of the provider this pull request is associated with.

sourceBranchRef.description: Source branch ref of this pull request

sourceRepositoryOwner.description: Owner of the source repository of this pull request

targetBranchRef.description: Target branch ref of this pull request

targetRepositoryOwner.description: Owner of the target repository of this pull request

autoCancel.description: Indicates if an update to a PR should delete current in-progress builds.

ReferenceLinks.description: The class to represent a collection of REST reference links.

links.description: The readonly view of the links.  Because Reference links are readonly, we only want to expose them as read only.

name.description: Release name.

RepositoryWebhook.description: Represents a repository's webhook returned from a source provider.

name.description: The friendly name of the repository.

values.description: Manual builds only.
A build should be started for each changeset.
A build should be started for multiple changesets at a time at a specified interval.
A build should be started on a specified schedule whether or not changesets exist.
A validation build should be started for each check-in.
A validation build should be started for each batch of check-ins.
A build should be triggered when a GitHub pull request is created or updated. Added in resource version 3
A build should be triggered when another build completes.
All types.

ResourceReference.description: Represents a reference to a resource.

alias.description: An alias to be used when referencing the resource.

RetentionLease.description: A valid retention lease prevents automated systems from deleting a pipeline run.

definitionId.description: The pipeline definition of the run.

leaseId.description: The unique identifier for this lease.

ownerId.description: Non-unique string that identifies the owner of a retention lease.

runId.description: The pipeline run protected by this lease.

validUntil.description: The last day the lease is considered valid.

RetentionPolicy.description: Represents a retention policy for a build definition.

daysToKeep.description: The number of days to keep builds.

deleteBuildRecord.description: Indicates whether the build record itself should be deleted.

deleteTestResults.description: Indicates whether to delete test results associated with the build.

minimumToKeep.description: The minimum number of builds to keep.

RetentionSetting.description: Contains the minimum, maximum, and current value for a retention setting.

daysToBuild.description: Days for a build (flags enum for days of the week)

values.description: Do not run.
Run on Monday.
Run on Tuesday.
Run on Wednesday.
Run on Thursday.
Run on Friday.
Run on Saturday.
Run on Sunday.
Run on all days of the week.

scheduleJobId.description: The Job Id of the Scheduled job that will queue the scheduled build. Since a single trigger can have multiple schedules and we want a single job to process a single schedule (since each schedule has a list of branches to build), the schedule itself needs to define the Job Id. This value will be filled in when a definition is added or updated.  The UI does not provide it or use it.

scheduleOnlyWithChanges.description: Flag to determine if this schedule should only build if the associated source has been changed.

timeZoneId.description: Time zone of the build schedule (String representation of the time zone ID)

SecureFileReference.description: Represents a reference to a secure file.

id.description: The ID of the secure file.

ServerTarget.description: Represents a phase target that runs on the server.

ServerTargetExecutionOptions.description: Represents options for running a phase on the server.

ServiceEndpointReference.description: Represents a referenec to a service endpoint.

id.description: The ID of the service endpoint.

name.description: The name of the source provider.

supportedCapabilities.description: The capabilities supported by this source provider.

supportedTriggers.description: The types of triggers supported by this source provider.

SourceRelatedWorkItem.description: Represents a work item related to some source item. These are retrieved from Source Providers.

assignedTo.description: Identity ref for the person that the work item is assigned to.

currentState.description: Current state of the work item, e.g. Active, Resolved, Closed, etc.

description.description: Long description for the work item.

id.description: Unique identifier for the work item

providerName.description: The name of the provider the work item is associated with.

title.description: Short name for the work item.

type.description: Type of work item, e.g. Bug, Task, User Story, etc.

SourceRepositories.description: A set of repositories returned from the source provider.

continuationToken.description: A token used to continue this paged request; 'null' if the request is complete

pageLength.description: The number of repositories requested for each page

totalPageCount.description: The total number of pages, or '-1' if unknown

SourceRepository.description: Represents a repository returned from a source provider.

defaultBranch.description: The name of the default branch.

fullName.description: The full name of the repository.

name.description: The friendly name of the repository.

sourceProviderName.description: The name of the source provider the repository is from.

SourceRepositoryItem.description: Represents an item in a repository from a source provider.

isContainer.description: Whether the item is able to have sub-items (e.g., is a folder).

path.description: The full path of the item, relative to the root of the repository.

type.description: The type of the item (folder, file, etc).

stageName.description: Name of the stage. Maximum supported length for name is 256 character.

defaultPollingInterval.description: The default interval to wait between polls (only relevant when NotificationType is Polling).

notificationType.description: How the trigger is notified of changes.

supportedCapabilities.description: The capabilities supported by this trigger.

values.description: The functionality is not supported.
The functionality is supported.
The functionality is required.
Manual builds only.
A build should be started for each changeset.
A build should be started for multiple changesets at a time at a specified interval.
A build should be started on a specified schedule whether or not changesets exist.
A validation build should be started for each check-in.
A validation build should be started for each batch of check-ins.
A build should be triggered when a GitHub pull request is created or updated. Added in resource version 3
A build should be triggered when another build completes.
All types.

TaskAgentPoolReference.description: Represents a reference to an agent pool.

isHosted.description: A value indicating whether or not this pool is managed by the service.

name.description: The pool name.

TaskDefinitionReference.description: A reference to a task definition.

definitionType.description: The type of task (task or task group).

message.description: Message explaining how user can correct if validation fails

TaskOrchestrationPlanGroupReference.description: Represents a reference to a plan group.

planGroup.description: The name of the plan group.

TaskOrchestrationPlanReference.description: Represents a reference to an orchestration plan.

TaskReference.description: Represents a reference to a task.

id.description: The ID of the task definition.

name.description: The name of the task definition.

version.description: The version of the task definition.

TeamProjectReference.description: Represents a shallow reference to a TeamProject.

defaultTeamImageUrl.description: Url to default team identity image.

name.description: Project name.

values.description: Project is in the process of being deleted.
Project is in the process of being created.
Project is completely created and ready to use.
Project has been queued for creation, but the process has not yet started.
All projects regardless of state.
Project has not been changed.
Project has been deleted.

url.description: Url to the full version of the object.

values.description: The project is only visible to users with explicit access.
The project is visible to all.

Timeline.description: Represents the timeline of a build.

lastChangedBy.description: The process or person that last changed the timeline.

lastChangedOn.description: The time the timeline was last changed.

attempt.description: Gets or sets the attempt of the record.

recordId.description: Gets or sets the record identifier located within the specified timeline.

timelineId.description: Gets or sets the timeline identifier which owns the record representing this attempt.

TimelineRecord.description: Represents an entry in a build's timeline.

currentOperation.description: A string that indicates the current operation.

errorCount.description: The number of errors produced by this operation.

identifier.description: String identifier that is consistent across attempts.

lastModified.description: The time the record was last modified.

log.description: A reference to the log produced by this operation.

name.description: The name.

order.description: An ordinal value relative to other records.

parentId.description: The ID of the record's parent.

queueId.description: The queue ID of the queue that the operation ran on.

task.description: A reference to the task represented by this timeline record.

url.description: The REST URL of the timeline record.

warningCount.description: The number of warnings produced by this operation.

workerName.description: The name of the agent running the operation.

TimelineReference.description: Represents a reference to a timeline.

url.description: The REST URL of the timeline.

UpdateProjectRetentionSettingModel.description: Contains members for updating the retention settings values. All fields are optional.

name.description: The name of the variable group.

type.description: The type of the variable group.

VariableGroupReference.description: Represents a reference to a variable group.

alias.description: The Name of the variable group.

id.description: The ID of the variable group.

VariableMultipliersAgentExecutionOptions.description: Represents options for running a phase based on values specified by a list of variables.

continueOnError.description: Indicates whether failure on one agent should prevent the phase from running on other agents.

maxConcurrency.description: The maximum number of agents to use in parallel.

VariableMultipliersServerExecutionOption.description: Represents options for running a phase based on values specified by a list of variables.

continueOnError.description: Indicates whether failure of one job should prevent the phase from running in other jobs.

maxConcurrency.description: The maximum number of server jobs to run in parallel.

VssJsonCollectionWrapper.description: This class is used to serialized collections as a single JSON object on the wire, to avoid serializing JSON arrays directly to the client, which can be a security hole

values.description: The path is mapped in the workspace.
The path is cloaked in the workspace.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified this template

lastModifiedDate.description: The last time this template was modified

workspaceId.description: Id of the workspace for this template

name.description: Name of the linked resource (definition name, controller name, etc.)

url.description: Full http link to the resource

createdOn.description: The date this definition was created

defaultDropLocation.description: Default drop location for builds from this definition

lastBuild.description: The last build on this definition

supportedReasons.description: The reasons supported by the template

values.description: No reason. This value should not be used.
The build was started manually.
The build was started for the trigger TriggerType.ContinuousIntegration.
The build was started for the trigger TriggerType.BatchedContinuousIntegration.
The build was started for the trigger TriggerType.Schedule.
The build was started for the trigger TriggerType.ScheduleForced.
The build was created by a user.
The build was started manually for private validation.
The build was started for the trigger ContinuousIntegrationType.Gated.
The build was started by a pull request. Added in resource version 3.
The build was started when another build completed.
The build was started when resources in pipeline triggered it
The build was triggered for retention policy purposes.
All reasons.

triggerType.description: How builds are triggered from this definition

values.description: Manual builds only.
A build should be started for each changeset.
A build should be started for multiple changesets at a time at a specified interval.
A build should be started on a specified schedule whether or not changesets exist.
A validation build should be started for each check-in.
A validation build should be started for each batch of check-ins.
A build should be triggered when a GitHub pull request is created or updated. Added in resource version 3
A build should be triggered when another build completes.
All types.

name.description: Name of the linked resource (definition name, controller name, etc.)

url.description: Full http link to the resource

url.description: Full http link to the resource

resources.description: The resources used by the build definition.

api-Version.name: api-version
api-Version.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '6.0' to use this version of the api.

api-Version-preview.1.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.1.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '6.0-preview.1' to use this version of the api.

api-Version-preview.2.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.2.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '6.0-preview.2' to use this version of the api.

accessToken.description: Personal access token. Use any value for the user name and the token as the password.

scopes.vso.build: Grants the ability to access build artifacts, including build results, definitions, and requests, and the ability to receive notifications about build events via service hooks.
scopes.vso.build_execute: Grants the ability to access build artifacts, including build results, definitions, and requests, and the ability to queue a build, update build properties, and the ability to receive notifications about build events via service hooks.
